author: Quotidiano Sportivo
title: Regional Division 1: A bitter round for CMV and Montemurlo - Quotidiano Sportivo
text:
Regional Division 1. A bitter round for CMV and Montemurlo The Centro Minibasket Valbisenzio's crisis worsens, while Montemurlo suffers its first league defeat. Third... di FRANCESCO BOCCHINI October 23, 2025 The sport of basketball
Centro Minibasket Valbisenzio's crisis deepens, while Montemurlo suffers its first league defeat. It's a third disappointing day for both Prato teams in Group B of Regional Division 1. Let's start with Angelo Iacopini's team, which loses its third consecutive game. At PalaNenni, Bonari and his teammates fall 61-82 to Scandicci, who dominates the proceedings from tip-off. The visitors start the match with a 10-2 run and lead 15-24 by the 10th minute. The gap between the two teams widens further in the second quarter, ending the score at 28-41. Vaiano is forced to finally throw in the towel in the second half, when the Florentines reach a 24-point lead.
Coming to Montemurlo, the Lions—returning from a forced suspension due to the postponement of their match against Synergy Valdarno—were defeated 87-71 on the Monteroni court. After a tight start, Siena broke away late in the first quarter. In the second, the red-and-whites even sank to within 21, while at halftime the scoreboard read 43-24. Game over? No, because coach Matteo Piperno's team put together a 25-15 run that allowed them to get back to within 9 with the entire final quarter to play. But the Lions' energy was exhausted, and Monteroni regained control of the game, ending the Prato team's hopes.
Francesco Bocchini
